name: syncopation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of musical rhythm in which strong notes are not on the beat: jazzy syncopations See
syncopated
More examplesFewer examples But neither the earthy ambivalence of the blues nor the elegant syncopation of ragtime is indigenous to New Orleans.Litton put a nice, dancey bounce on Handel's syncopations. The crisp syncopation, reminiscent of a samba beat, belies the dark, almost despondent lyrics.But the fun still came across, in music skipping in dotted rhythms and syncopations.
